question.content: For your final answer to the user, you must respond in this format: {'answer': A short and precise answer to the question, 'context': A brief explanation of how you arrived at this answer or why it is correct}. If you do not know the answer, respond with {'answer': 'I do not know', 'context': 'I do not know'}. If you think the question cannot be properly answered, response with {'answer': 'I cannot answer this question', 'context': A short reason explaining why this question cannot be answered}.

National parks preserve the natural beauty and biodiversity of a country, often holding deep historical significance. In which year was the first national park established in the birth country of the driver who won the 2024 Formula 1 World Championship?

function.name: search_engine_query
function.description: This tool belongs to the Web Search API category. It provides functions to search the web and browse search results. Tool description: This function queries the search engine for the provided keywords and region. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

max_results.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

region.description: The region to search in. Defaults to 'wt-wt' (No region).

function.name: fetch_url_content
function.description: This tool belongs to the Web Search API category. It provides functions to search the web and browse search results. Tool description: This function retrieves content from the provided URL and processes it based on the selected mode. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

url.description: The URL to fetch content from. Must start with 'http://' or 'https://'.

mode.description: The mode to process the fetched content. `raw` returns the raw HTML content; `markdown` converts raw HTML content to Markdown format for better readability, using html2text; `truncate` extracts and cleans text by removing scripts, styles, and extraneous whitespace.

content.description: The processed web content as a string.

step_2.content: [{'title': 'List of national parks of the Netherlands - Wikipedia', 'href': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_national_parks_of_the_Netherlands', 'body': 'National Parks in the Netherlands In the 1960s, national parks in the Netherlands were defined as areas of at least 10 square kilometres (3.9 sq mi) consisting of natural terrains, water and/or forests, with a special landscape and flora and fauna. [1] The first two national parks were founded in the 1930s by private organisations.'}, {'title': 'History | Nationale Parken', 'href': 'https://nationaleparken.nl/en/about-us/history', 'body': 'The oldest national park in the world is located in the northern United States of America. This is Yellowstone National Park, established in 1872. In Europe, the first national park was established in 1909: Sarek in Swedish Lapland. This park, with over 100 glaciers, is on the UNESCO World Heritage List.'}, {'title': 'Netherlands National Park | National Parks Association', 'href': 'https://nationalparksassociation.org/country/netherlands-national-parks/', 'body': 'The first national park established in the Netherlands was Veluwezoom National Park (Nationaal Park Veluwezoom). It was designated as a national park on January 25, 1930.'}, {'title': 'Veluwezoom National Park (Official GANP Park Page)', 'href': 'https://www.national-parks.org/netherlands/veluwezoom', 'body': 'Veluwezoom National Park is located in the province of Gelderland which is situated on the eastern side of central Netherlands. The park covers an area of 19 square miles (50 sq km). Veluwezoom was the first national park established in the Netherlands protecting the southeastern portion of the Veluwe.'}, {'title': 'The 21 National Parks in the Netherlands', 'href': 'https://exploringthenetherlands.com/national-parks-netherlands/', 'body': 'A national park covering the area was first proposed by Dutch biologist and conservationist Jacobus Pieter Thijsse in the 1940s, and the original De Kennemerland National Park was established in 1950.'}, {'title': "National Parks in Netherlands (Holland, Friesland...): Don't Miss Out", 'href': 'https://www.globalnationalparks.com/netherlands/', 'body': 'Although the first initiatives to create these spaces began in the 1930s thanks to private organizations, it was not until 1989 that the first official national park, Schiermonnikoog, was established. The most recent, De Alde Feanen National Park, was added to the list in April 2006.'}, {'title': 'Origin of the National Park Idea (U.S. National Park Service)', 'href': 'https://www.nps.gov/articles/npshistory-origins.htm', 'body': "Origin of the National Park Idea The concept of national parks was one of the most popular ideas the United States ever produced. It stemmed from the desire to protect special places for visitors' present and future enjoyment. Since Yellowstone was designated in 1872, the concept of what constitutes a national park has expanded significantly."}, {'title': '20 Amazing National Parks in the Netherlands', 'href': 'https://www.netherlands-tourism.com/20-amazing-national-parks-in-the-netherlands/', 'body': 'The first national park in the Netherlands is on the southeastern cusp of the Veluwe and dates to 1931. One of the hillier parks on this list, the Veluwezoom gets up to 110 metres above sea level, and these peaks are pushed moraines sculpted during the Saalian Glaciation some 150,000 years ago.'}, {'title': 'List of the U.S. National Parks by Date Established (the Oldest and ...', 'href': 'https://www.dirtinmyshoes.com/list-of-us-national-parks-date-established/', 'body': 'The United States of America was the first country in the world to designate a national park! Now, there are 63 official national parks in the U.S. Here is a list of U.S. National Parks by the date they were established (oldest to newest):'}, {'title': 'The national parks of the Netherlands | Nationale Parken', 'href': 'https://nationaleparken.nl/en', 'body': 'Get to know the national parks All the national parks together showcase the great diversity of nature in the Netherlands. From dunes to river nature, from forest and heathlands to peat: each park has its own story. Formed by the interaction between water and land, and between humans and nature.'}]

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
National park in Gelderland, the Netherlands
Veluwezoom National Park
Nationaal Park Veluwezoom
IUCN category
II (
national park
)
Posbank (part of the national park)
Map of the national park

Gelderland
,
Netherlands

Area
50 km
2
(19 sq mi)

1930
(
1930
)
[
1
]
Governing body
Natuurmonumenten
www
.natuurmonumenten

/natmm-internet

Veluwezoom National Park
is a
national park in the Netherlands
located in the
province
of
Gelderland
. It is the oldest national park in the Netherlands.
[
2
]
It has a surface area of about 50 square kilometers (some 20 square miles) at the southeastern edge of the
Veluwe
, a complex of terminal
push moraines
from the
Saalian glaciation
. The park has a pronounced relief by Dutch standards, with its highest point at 110 metres (360 ft) above
sea level
.
[
3
]
It is a private national park, owned by
Vereniging Natuurmonumenten
, the largest nature conservation organisation in the Netherlands.
The landscape of the park consists of
forest
and
heath
kept open by grazing
Highland cattle
, and a small
sand drift
kept open by human maintenance. The native fauna is
red deer
,
wild boar
,
badger
, and the regionally rare
pine marten
.

step_4.content: [{'title': 'Complete Guide to Veluwezoom National Park: History, Activities, and More', 'href': 'https://www.globalnationalparks.com/netherlands/veluwezoom/', 'body': 'Veluwezoom National Park is the oldest in the Netherlands, established in 1930. Its history reflects efforts to preserve the natural landscapes of Veluwe, an area known for its heathlands and forests, located just 21 km from the Hoge Veluwe National Park.'}, {'title': 'Veluwezoom National Park - National Parks Association', 'href': 'https://nationalparksassociation.org/netherlands-national-park/veluwezoom-national-park/', 'body': "Veluwezoom National Park, established in 1930, is the Netherlands' oldest national park, located in the province of Gelderland. This protected natural area spans approximately 50 square kilometers (about 19 square miles), offering a breathtaking landscape of dense woodlands, heathlands, sand drifts, and country estates."}, {'title': 'Veluwezoom National Park - Wikipedia', 'href': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veluwezoom_National_Park', 'body': 'Veluwezoom National Park is a national park in the Netherlands located in the province of Gelderland. It is the oldest national park in the Netherlands. [2] It has a surface area of about 50 square kilometers (some 20 square miles) at the southeastern edge of the Veluwe, a complex of terminal push moraines from the Saalian glaciation.'}, {'title': 'Veluwezoom National Park (Official GANP Park Page)', 'href': 'https://www.national-parks.org/netherlands/veluwezoom', 'body': 'Veluwezoom National Park is located in the province of Gelderland which is situated on the eastern side of central Netherlands. The park covers an area of 19 square miles (50 sq km). Veluwezoom was the first national park established in the Netherlands protecting the southeastern portion of the Veluwe.'}, {'title': 'Veluwezoom National Park - Exploring the Netherlands', 'href': 'https://exploringthenetherlands.com/veluwezoom-national-park/', 'body': "Veluwezoom National Park is a gorgeous and appealing national park, located in the eastern Netherlands. A semi-rugged landscape that's covered in heath, forest, sand drifts, hills, and even a few country estates, Veluwezoom National Park is one of the highlights of Gelderland province, with many fascinating features."}, {'title': "Ultimate Guide to the Netherlands' Veluwezoom National Park", 'href': 'https://sworld.blog/guide-to-veluwezoom-national-park/', 'body': "Veluwezoom National Park is one of the most captivating nature reserves in the Netherlands. Located in the province of Gelderland near the city of Arnhem, it is part of the larger Veluwe region and stands as the country's oldest national park, officially designated in 1931. Veluwezoom is known for its varied landscapes, rolling hills, and vibrant heathlands that transform into a sea of ..."}, {'title': 'What is the size of Veluwezoom National Park? - TravelAsker', 'href': 'https://travelasker.com/what-is-the-size-of-veluwezoom-national-park/', 'body': 'In 1930, Veluwezoom was officially established as the first national park in the Netherlands. The main purpose of the park was to protect the unique landscape and biodiversity of the area. Over the years, the park has undergone several changes and upgrades to enhance its conservation efforts and to provide a better experience for visitors.'}, {'title': 'Veluwezoom National Park - USA National Parks', 'href': 'https://www.usanationalparks.info/veluwezoom-national-park/', 'body': "Veluwezoom National Park Nestled in the heart of the Netherlands, Veluwezoom National Park stands as a testament to the nation's commitment to preserving its natural heritage. Located in the province of Gelderland, on the eastern edge of the country's central region, this sprawling sanctuary encompasses approximately 50 square kilometers (19 square miles) of diverse landscapes, making it a ..."}, {'title': 'Nationaal Park De Veluwezoom- All You Need To Know About', 'href': 'https://aboutnl.com/nationaal-park-de-veluwezoom/', 'body': "The Veluwezoom National Park is one of the Netherlands' most popular and extensive national park, with over 50 square kilometers. It is located in the province of Gelderland, and the park is only an hour east of Amsterdam."}, {'title': 'National Park Veluwezoom | Nationale Parken', 'href': 'http://nationaleparken.nl/en/the-parks/national-park-veluwezoom', 'body': 'Hills and Vistas Nowhere else on the Veluwe will you find so many hills and be able to see as far as in the Veluwezoom National Park, which is part of the large contiguous nature reserve of the Veluwe. In the unspoiled nature with forests, heathlands, sand drifts, and estates, you may encounter wild animals such as red deer and wild boar.'}]
